items.content:
Lovely to see you again! I hope you have had good day so far.

Today's lesson is going to be a little bit different than usual. Instead of me teaching you about a certain subject, you are going to teach yourself through this website.

So in summary, this is what we will be doing today:

  1. Watch a short video as introduction to the subject and make it's excercise t.
  2. Watch and interview and a recorded lecture and make it's excercises.
  3. Watch a video on how to write a letter and make it's excercises.
  4. Make part 1 and 2 of the final test
  5. Fill out the questionnaire (vragenlijst) at the end.
WARNING: All the information as well as the questions are in English.
At the end of this lesson you will be able to discribe the Uighur (Oeigoeren) situation in China and why this is happening.

prompt.body: WATCH the video and SELECT the sentences that are TRUE

content.body: The girl talks about what is happening to the Uighurs in China.
Correct. The girl is giving detailed examples of what is happening to the Uighurs.
The girl talks about why this is happening to Uighurs in China.
False. The girl does not give a reason for what is happening to the Uighurs.
The girl talks about how good the Uighurs have it in China.
False: The girl only talks about the bad things that are happening to the Uighurs.
The girl tells us to do research.
Correct. The girl says: 'Use your phone to search up what is happening in China right now'.

items.content:
Before we go continue with the lesson, you are going to take a look at some words that you will see/hear later on.

Go to the right down to the lower right corner of the Quizlet screen and choose your way of learning.

Go through the words until you're sure you know them, this is going to help you later on.

When you're done, go to the next slide.

As always there are always two sides to every story.

We have seen a Tiktok girl who spoke on the Uighur situation. Now it is time for you to see how a representative of the Chinese government looks at the situation.

In the video down below you will see the Chinese amabasdor to the United Kingdom react to the question of a reporter about the Uighur situation in Xinjiang.
Now that we have seen a Tiktok user describe the situation in China and seen a representative of the Chinese government. It is time for me to show you the facts about the Uighur situation in China.
Make the excercises on the next slide.

introduction.body:
Now that you have watched the video in which a presented the Uighur situation, it is time for you to refresh your mind. Make the following question and take a good look at the feedback form that you will get to see at the end of the test.

We are going to use this information letter on in the lesson.

content.body: Most practice a religion called . The make out a small portion of the population in China which makes them a . They live in a province called where they make up a big portion of the population which makes them a . Their language is very similar to . And their ancestors were believed to have come from the .
Xinjiang
Uighurs
majority
Northern part of Central Asia
minority
Islam
Turkish
That is correct!

This is not correct. The correct answer is:

Most Uighurs practice a religion called Islam. The make out a small portion of the population in China which makes them a minority. They live in a province called Xinjiang where they make up a big portion of the population which makes them a majority . Their language is very similar to Turkish. And their ancestors were believed to have come from the Northern part of Central Asia.

prompt.body: Drag the text to its correct spot to finish the sentences.

content.body: they put the Uighurs in re-education camps to prevent the terrorist threats within their community.
China wants to expend their export route to the west that goes straight through Xjinjiang.
people from all around the world to come up with ways to help.
The real reason for the harsh treatment of the Uighurs is because..
The chinese government said in a public statement that...
The leakage of video footage from within the camps caused..
Great job!

That is a pity.. The correct answers are:


The real reason for the harsh treatment of the Uighurs is because..
China wants to expend their export route to the west that goes straight through Xjinjiang.

The chinese government said in a public statement that...
they put the Uighurs in re-education camps to prevent the terrorist threats within their community.

The leakage of video footage from within the camps caused..
people from all around the world to come up with ways to help.

22countries have send a letter to council of the UN. In this letter they say howthey find the situation of thein China. Countries who have signed a letter stating their to the are Egypt, Pakistan en Afghanistan. Their decision to do this is purely decision.
Amazing!

Oeh, better luck next time..

The correct answers are:

22 western countries have send a letter to the human rights ouncil of the UN. In this letter they say how disgusting they find the situation of the Uighurs in China. Countries who have signed a letter stating their support to the Chinese government are Egypt, Pakistan en Afghanistan. Their decision to do this is purely economic.

Click on the correct wordt that explain the bad things that are happening to the Uighur people.

example:

Uighurs are being kidnapped and beaten by soldiers

words that should be selected:

Uirghurs are being kidnapped and beaten by soldiers.

Now it's up to you:

1.Uighurs are being snatched and tortured in camps.

2.Uighurfamilies are separated from each other.

3. Uighurchildren brainwashed.

4.Uighurs arecontinuously watched.
Super!

Thats unfortunate.. The correct answers are:

1. Uighurs are being snatched and tortured in camps.
2. Uighur families are separated from each other.
3. Uighur children are brainwashed.
4. Uighurs are continuously watched.

prompt.body:
In the presentation we have talked a little bit about what people around the world are doing to help the Uighurs. We have also looked at what Amnesty International suggests what we should do.

Now you are to make a suggestion on how to help the Uighurs.

You are going to explain in 50 words your idea on how to help the Uighurs and why you think it would be a good idea.

values.value:
Example:

I think that the best way to help the Uighurs would be to send western soldiers to China to fight and help break free the Uighurs in the camps. This would be a good idea because china is just one country with one army, the western world has multiple armies and more soldiers.

 

  • 53 words.

content.body:
Example:

I think that the best way to help the Uighurs would be to send western soldiers to China to fight and help break free the Uighurs in the camps. This would be a good idea because china is just one country with one army, the western world has multiple armies and more soldiers.

  • 53 words.

items.content: Before we move on to our orientation questions about writing a letter. let's watch the video down below in which the speaker explains to us how to write one.
Now, go to the next slide and make the questions.

prompt.body: What is the first step we take before writing a letter?

content.body: Decide who we are writing to.
Correct: The speaker says that before we start writing we should decide who we are writing to.
Decide what we are going to write about.
Incorrect: the speaker does not say that we should first decide what we are going to write about.
Write down the adress the letter has to be sent to.
Incorrect: the speaker does not say that we should first write down the adress the letter is going to.
Decide how we are going to open our letter.
Incorrect: the speaker does not say that we should first decide how we should open our letter.

prompt.body: Drag the texts to their correct place to complete the sentences.

content.body: formal letters
informal letters
Letters that we write to somebody important like you boss are called..
Letters that we write to somebody we know well like our brother are called..
Very well!

That is unfortunate.. The correct combinations are:

Letters that we write to somebody important like you boss are called..
formal letters

Letters that we write to somebody we know well like our brother are called..​
informal letters

prompt.body:
As we have heard in the video, a letter should consist of 5 parts.

Put the parts below in the order a letter should be written in according to the video.

content.body: Closing.
Greeting the receiver of the letter.
The date.
Body.
Your signature.
Great job!

That is a pity.. The correct order is:

1. The date.
2. Greeting the receiver of the letter.
3. Body.
4. Closing.
5. Your signature.

prompt.body: Now that we know what parts should be included in a letter, we are going to match what information should be included into what part.

content.body: In this part you can show that the letter you have written has ended. And depending on who you are writing to you can decide the ending of your letter.
In this part we write down our own name, so that the receiver knows who has written the letter.
In this part we write down the date you are writing the letter.
In this part you are going to write down your thoughts, ideas and questions.
In this part we are going to greet the receiver of the letter.
Date
Greeting
Body
Closing
Signature
Very well!

That is incorrect:

The correct combinations are:

Date
In this part we write down the date you are writing the letter.

Greeting
In this part we are going to greet the receiver of the letter.

Body
In this part you are going to write down your thoughts, ideas and questions.

Closing
In this part you can show that the letter you have written has ended. And depending on who you are writing to you can decide the ending of your letter.

Signature
In this part we write down our own name, so that the receiver knows who has written the letter.

prompt.body:
The sentences you see below are examples of information that you have listened to in the previous presentation.

Select which sentences you would include in your own letter.

Important to know is that in this question there is no right or wrong. It is just so that you have an idea of parts of information youw are going to include in your own letter.

content.body: The Uighurs make up to the minority of the population in China. However, when we look just at the province Xinjiang we can conclude that they made up the majority of the people living their.
Interesting choice.
The news as well as social media are slowly starting to expose what is happening to the Uighurs in their homeland.
You could definitely use that.
the Uighurs that live overseas are also harassed by the Chinese government.
Very well.
The China the government stated that the reason for the camps was to prevent the terrorism within the Uighur population.
Great choice.
Since the leakage of multiple videos made within these camps, people from all walks of life have created ways to help the Uighurs.
Interesting choice.
There are also countries who have not signed this letter, but another one in which they express their support towards the Chinese government.
You could definitely use that.

items.content:
Now that we know that a letter consists out of 5 parts, you will be making your own writing plan.

Write under every part what you will be discussing.

Example:
date: 9 novembre 2020
Greeting; Dear sir/madam,
Body: What is happening in China, why it is happening and what the world does to help.
Closing: Yours sincerely,
Signature: Amina

After listening to some information and creating your own writing plan, it is time for you to make the final test.

Answer the questions down below and make sure you submit them afterwards. This will also count as your attendence this lesson.

Good luck!

Thank you for participating (meedoen) in today's lesson!

Important for you to know is that the results of these questions will only be used as evidence for my own final exams. Your names will of course be masked.

If you have any question about today's lesson, or if you have any concerns about the results of your excercises you can find me in room L_01 or e-mail me stadi@wolfert.nl.

I hope that you'll have an awesome week ahead of you and with that a great vacation!!
